content: This article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Paya Lebar Single Member Constituency" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(January 2022)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Paya Lebar Single Member Constituency** was a constituency in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). It used to exist from 1955 to 1988 as **Paya Lebar Constituency** and was renamed as **Paya Lebar Single Member Constituency** (SMC) as part of Singapore's political reforms. The SMC was merged into [Aljunied Group Representation Constituency](/wiki/Aljunied_Group_Representation_Constituency) in 1991. ## Member of Parliament YearMember of ParliamentParty[Legislative Assembly of Singapore](/wiki/Legislative_Assembly_of_Singapore)**1955**[Lim Koon Teck](/wiki/Lim_Koon_Teck)[PP](/wiki/Progressive_Party_(Singapore))**1959**[Tan Kia Gan](/wiki/Tan_Kia_Gan)[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)**1963**Kow Kee Seng[BS](/wiki/Barisan_Sosialis)[Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore)**1968**Tay Boon Too[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)**1972****1976**Tan Cheng San**1980**Sia Kah Hui**1984**Philip Tan Tee Yong**1988** ## Electoral results Note: The [Elections Department](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) does not include rejected votes when calculating the vote shares of candidates. Hence, all candidates' vote shares will total to 100% at any given election (may not appear so in multi-way contests due to rounding). ### Elections in 1950s [General Election 1955](/wiki/1955_Singaporean_general_election): Paya Lebar PartyCandidateVotes%±%[PP](/wiki/Progressive_Party_(Singapore))[Lim Koon Teck](/wiki/Lim_Koon_Teck)3,33052.1[DP](/wiki/Democratic_Party_(Singapore))Tan Eng Joo3,06547.9[Majority](/wiki/Majority#Related_terms)2654.2N/A[Turnout](/wiki/Voter_turnout)6,49450.6[PP](/wiki/Progressive_Party_(Singapore)) **win** (new seat)[General Election 1959](/wiki/1959_Singaporean_general_election): Paya Lebar PartyCandidateVotes%±%[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)[Tan Kia Gan](/wiki/Tan_Kia_Gan)6,53160.8[Independent](/wiki/Independent_(politician))Ong Chye Hock4,20939.2[Majority](/wiki/Majority#Related_terms)2,32221.6N/A[Turnout](/wiki/Voter_turnout)10,84289.7[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) **gain** from [SPA](/wiki/Singapore_People%27s_Alliance)[Swing](/wiki/Swing_(politics)) ### Elections in 1960s [General Election 1963](/wiki/1963_Singaporean_general_election): Paya Lebar PartyCandidateVotes%±%[BS](/wiki/Barisan_Sosialis)Kow Kee Seng6,15248.0[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)Tan Kia Gan5,40242.1−18.7[UPP](/wiki/United_People%27s_Party_(Singapore))Lau Tok Keong8586.7[SA](/wiki/Singapore_Alliance)Goh Yeow Dek4153.2[Majority](/wiki/Majority#Related_terms)7505.9[Turnout](/wiki/Voter_turnout)12,94695.6[BS](/wiki/Barisan_Sosialis) **gain** from [PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)[Swing](/wiki/Swing_(politics)) ## Historical maps This [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) location article is a stub.
